title: Hortense Diédhiou
text: Hortense (also spelled Hortance, Hortence and Hortanse) Diédhiou (born 19 August 1983) is a <a href="Senegal">Senegal</a>ese <a href="judo">judo</a>ka. She participated in three Olympic games: <a href="Judo%20at%20the%202004%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%2052%20kg">2004 in the -52kg</a> event, <a href="Judo%20at%20the%202008%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%2052%20kg">2008 at -52kg</a> and <a href="Judo%20at%20the%202012%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%2057%20kg">2012 at -57kg</a>. She was the flag bearer of Senegal at the <a href="2012%20Summer%20Olympics%20opening%20ceremony">2012 Summer Olympics opening ceremony</a>. At the 2004 Olympics, she met <a href="Fr%C3%A9d%C3%A9rique%20Jossinet">Frédérique Jossinet</a> who invited her to train in France. Following that recommendation Diédhiou moved to <a href="Provence">Provence</a> and in 2011 to Paris.
